rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment reports scale and action factually ('More than 15 million... have been killed') without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment uses a plain outcome verb ('killed') with a large number ('More than 15 million'), but plain outcome verbs are excluded from Q3 unless other cues fire.
The segment reports the number of birds killed but contains no explicit calming language.
No minimiser ('only', 'just', 'merely', 'a single', 'few') combined with an explicit scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
